text: materials eposi hener carpet dope Zin
sulfide powder plastic cup
stick itto glass and razor
blade Scotch tape carpet tape DC AC
inverter pzo generator and wires with
alligator
clips phosphor paste
preparation take the epoy using a
syringe and place it into the plastic
cup record the weight of the
epoxy mix two parts of the epoxy with
one part of hardener by weight
add an equal amount of phosphor by
weight and mix together
thoroughly wait about 4 hours for the
mixture to partially cure this will make
it easier to dror
Blade device
fabrication identify the conductive side
of a tin ox side coated piece of glass
using a multimeter the conducting side
will have a finite resistance of 20 to
ohms with a conductive side up tape the
glass on three sides using one thickness
of tape make sure the tape has a good
contact with the
glass add a small amount of phosphor
paste and quickly spray it by pushing
with with a razor blade the tape serves
as a 50 microm spacer to control the
thickness of the foser
layer place a glass on a h plate at 55Â°
C for 2 hours until it is
cured device testing
carefully remove the tape without
scratching the coating you can see the
phospher layer above 50 microm
thick use a carpet tape as the top
electrod place it in the middle of the
phosphor layer carefully rub the top
surface to ensure a good electrical
contact
connect the phospher LED with a PSO
generator obtain from a lighter with
alligator clips and turn the glass
upside
down click on the generator to apply
around 50 to 20 kilov Volt across a
phospher layer you can see blue emission
line due to electr
luminesence or you can connect the LED
with with a DC AC inverter powered by a
DC power supply set the DC voltage to 5
volt and it gives a 650 volt AC output
voltage and a frequency of 80
KZ you can see the LED glowing this is a
view from under the itl glass in the
dark here is a close look the peak w l
of the BL LED is around 455
nanom you can also use flexible
transparency as the substrate use two
strips of copper tape as electrodes then
connect it with the PSO
generator once again you can see the
blue emission coming out of the phospher
layer
